availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Catherine Smith Overton Green (Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Daughter of Dabney Carr Overton and Eliza D. Harris. Married Grant Green in Frankfort, Kentucky, on February 28, 1855. Mother of Henry D. Green and Eliza O. Green. Resident in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Franklin County, Frankfort, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 501.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 238.
_Find A Grave, “Catherine Smith Overton Green (October 11, 1837 to July 28 1899),” Memorial #63467921, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63467921/catherine-smith-green (accessed April 12, 2019).
"Tri-Weekly Kentucky Yeoman, 1855-03-01," Kentucky Digital Newspaper Program, https://kentuckynewspapers.org/catalog/xt7w9g5gf25f-z?q=Kate+Overton (accessed April 12, 2019).
Edmund L. Starling, History of Henderson County, Kentucky (Henderson, Kentucky, 1887), 608 (accessed via google books).
